definition: Dongdong, cheerleading mascot of 2008 Beijing Olympics

sentences.english: He did not respond I have only concentrated on the very floor to Dongdong Dong.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有迴應我，只顧咚咚咚上得樓來。

sentences.english: The  boy thumped down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩咚咚地跑下樓梯。

sentences.english: The stillness of night was broken by the boom of a drum.
sentences.chinese: 夜的寂靜被鼓的咚咚聲打破了。

sentences.english: He drummed his fingers on the table.
sentences.chinese: 他用手指在餐桌上咚咚地敲打。

sentences.english: He drummed his feet on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他用腳咚咚地敲擊地板。

sentences.english: The metal dish clattered down the stone stairs.
sentences.chinese: 金屬盤子叮叮咚咚滾下了石階。

sentences.english: They each found their favorite milk and drank it at once.
sentences.chinese: 他們都找到了自己喜歡的牛奶，立刻咕咚咚喝起來。

sentences.english: In the evening, the door came a knock at the door.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚時分，門外傳來咚咚的敲門聲。
“咚咚咚”，小明輕輕地敲了幾下門。

sentences.english: I can hear the rain drumming on the roof .
sentences.chinese: 我能聽到雨點打在屋頂上咚咚作響。

sentences.english: I was doing my homework suddenly I heard some sound of "Dong! Dong!
sentences.chinese: 我正在做作業呢，忽然聽到“咚咚咚”的聲音。

sentences.english: Don't crash about upstairs while I'm working.
sentences.chinese: 我工作時，別在樓上咚咚地跑來跑去。

sentences.english: As Tong Tong Tui sounds, two villagers begin to perform Nuo Opera.
sentences.chinese: 隨着“咚咚推”響起，兩位村民開始表演儺戲。

sentences.english: Jed's heart began to beat heavily.
sentences.chinese: 傑德的心開始“咚咚”直跳。

sentences.english: A drum roll preceded the most dangerous part of the performance.
sentences.chinese: 演出快進行到最驚險的部分時響起了咚咚的鼓聲。

sentences.english: It see the girl closed the door, then hand "pound" knock on the door.
sentences.chinese: 它見姑娘家門關著，便用手“咚咚”敲門。

definition: child's buttocks (esp. Cantonese)/(onom.) crack, slap, clap, clatter etc
thumping sound (onom.)/to be eager and anxious (to do sth)/faithful and upright
(onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
